techmeme.title: The US needs a new cybersecurity strategy, but offensive cyber operations are unlikely to deter Chinese state-sponsored hacking and come with significant risk (Marcus Hutchins/MalwareTech)
A survey of 1,450 verified Indian IT professionals by Blind: 83% reported experiencing burnout, with 72% saying they routinely exceed the 48-hour workweek limit (John Xavier/The Hindu)
USPTO suspended xAI's Grok trademark application, saying the name could be confused with companies Groq and Grokstream; startup Bizly claims rights to "Grok" (Zoë Schiffer/Wired)
OpenAI's new image generator, powered by GPT-4o, is now available to all users; Altman last week mentioned a limit of three images per day for free-tier users (Ivan Mehta/TechCrunch)
Industry executives say Rapido has a 20% share in India's four-wheeler ride-hailing segment; Uber has a ~50% share, while Ola holds most of the remaining 30% (The Economic Times)
